column1: There is a great park here
column3: where dogs run with bones to pick; and this habit of the dogs suits the crows perfectly
column4: for they always try to get away the bones
column5: and often succeed too. This is the way they usually go to work. The first crow that sees a dog with a bone calls all his friends
column6: and off they fly to where the dog is. There they alight and stand around him. Then they talk to one another. Perhaps one says
column8: "This is an ugly cur;" another says
column10: "His tail is cut off;" and so they keep talking until the dog gets angry
column11: and with a snap and a bark
column12: tries to drive them away. This only makes them laugh; and they begin again to torment the dog by talking
column13: and even by jumping upon his back
